Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Dominique Dreyer, Swiss ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Sunday.
 Present there were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and the resident coordinator of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation of the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: Chinese Government Decides to Donate Aid
articles.content:
Chinese Government Decides to Donate Aid 
    Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The government of the People's Republic of China decided to donate aid to the DPRK.
 Li Changchun, head of the Chinese party and government delegation, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK informed Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, of this on Saturday.    
 The donation will give a strong impetus to the people of the DPRK who are stepping up the building of a great prosperous powerful nation.

British Foreign Ministry Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland led by Bill Rammell, deputy secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, arrived here Saturday.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by an official concerned and the British ambassador e. p. to the DPRK.

Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
    Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of sympathy to Megawati Soekarnoputri, president of Indonesia, today.
 Upon hearing the sad news that loss of many lives were caused a recent bomb explosion in Jakarta claimed huge casualties, I express deep sympathy and consolation to the Indonesian government and people, the message said.    
 Strongly condemning brutal terrorism, the message expressed the belief that the Indonesian president and government would eradicate the aftermath of the terror and bring the living of the bereaved families of the victims to normal as early as possible.
